channel.title: Sigma (framework)- thread layout updated -Inactive
channel.description:
Edit:: If anyone has advice or questions my msn is: davidcntt@hotmail.com, This topic will be kept for the history of it, but I'm not going to bother updating it for now, I am still working on this though... [s] [center]Currently[/center] [s]Looking at someway to run tasks or events in parallel through the server core, for example currently its set up to go through and update players, but after I add npc's and items, with the current setup they would most likely be added to be done after players had been completely finished (as it is with winterlove). I am currently looking and researching for a way to run them in tandem.[/s]
[s]Will implement this and compare it to my current method (an event driven threadpool executor? [ha, can't think of a name, essentially tasks are submitted to an event manager that handles tasks by allocating them to the threadpool which can create or destroy threads based on if they are needed]). [/s] [s]Got Distracted, so I wrote up an item system, and it turned out decently. Pic added in the media section.[/s] Wrote a good Npc system, it consists of 2 lists, a global list (includes all npc's that are spawned or need spawning), and then a second list which only includes npc's that need to perform an action (updating, movement or combat)
Alright every-one, I've had this framework that I have been working on for quite a long time actually. Its based on this: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/origrs2/]Index of /origrs2/[/url] which is the first rsps ever, the infamous the "flight around runescape." Probably around 70-80 percent of the code or method of doing things is not my creation, instead inspiration was drawn from other sources. I'll skip right to the framework.
[center]Features[/center]
[ul][*]Server Core [list] [*]Mina Networking [*]Rewritten Server Core [*]Most code follows semi-proper conventions and has sufficient documentation [*]Very Stable [*]The server uses a custom event manager(based on grahams, however timer accuracy is improved and now it uses a list) [*]Most synchronization errors have been avoided. [/list]
[*]Server Content (Multiplayer Features) [list] [*]Login [*]Multiplayer [*]Rendering [*]Gfx [*]Animations [*]Walking [*]Talking [*]Items [*]Npcs [/list] [*]Player Updating [list] [*]Server uses a linked list for connected players rather than an array [*]A very basic region updating system (ILY Colby) [*]I also have the standard winterlove approach (looping through all players). [/list][/ul]
[center]Future Features[/center]
[ul][*]Combat [list] [*]range [list] [*]projectiles [*]maxhit [*]following [*]all weapons [list] [*]bows [*]crossbows [*]thrownaxes [*]javelins [*]darts [*]throwing knives [/list] [/list] [*]mage [list] [*]currect delays [*]correct gfx [*]correct timers [*]ancient spell effects [list] [*]blood [*]ice [*]shadow [*]smoke [/list] [/list] [*]melee [list] [*]maxhit formula [*]weapon animations [*]weapon speeds [/list] [*]prayer [*]specials [list] [*]range weapons [list] [*]rune thrownaxe [*]dark bow [*]magic longbow [*]magic shortbow [/list] [*]melee weapons [/list] [/list][/ul]
Trading Object Interactions Item Interactions
Tell me your opinion guys. At least remember that this is a project to increase my understanding of rsps and java in general, so do not be exceedingly critical. I do not expect this to be the best source in existence, I've always found that the best way for me to learn is by looking at complete code, and then comprehension of that code.
[center]Credits[/center]
The sources that were used as reference in this project include: shards, hyperion, rune-fusion, and battlescape. A huge thanks to the member's of these projects who have made these amazing server bases possible.
Graham-he has done so much for rsps, its inspiring. Blakeman8192- truly the rsps pioneer, he is amazing. Colby, super_, popcorn, and any other people that have contributed tools and information to assist the development of rsps.
[center]Media[/center] Just a picture. Ingame picture, player updating, chat, multiplayer. [img]http://img261.imageshack.us/img261/6708/pictureforthread.png[/img] Just another picture. Shows ground item support, only the player that dropped the item can see it for a certain amount of time, after this period of time, all players can see it. [img]http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/3746/items2.png[/img] Yet another picture. Shows Npc spawning, Ncp's are loaded from a cfg file (will change to dat later) that contains the Npc X, Y and Z spawnpoints and the Npc Id. I am surprised if anyone reads these captions. [img]http://img838.imageshack.us/img838/3504/npcsy.png[/img][/s]

item.title: Sigma (framework)- thread layout updated -Inactive
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

Pure Demons:

I can’t seem to find the link to any javadocs, would you please PM it or post it? And any other information you used if you still have the links.

I’ll look for some links. Ill pm you back later.

Edit::
Besides Mina documentation these are sites that I’ve frequented.
http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/ (official javadocs)
http://geosoft.no/development/javastyle.html#Naming%20Conventions (convention guide)
http://www.javaworld.com/ (simple explanations on java topics)

Mainly just those sites, besides blogs / posts I’ve found when researching specific topic.
I’ll post this one separate cause it was a good learning experience / helpful.

JavaWorld

Java performance programming, Part 1: Smart object-management saves the day

Excessive object creation can be a huge problem in Java programs. Despite continuing improvements in JVM technology for memory management, the object creation and garbage collection cycle is still a very expensive operation. If frequently used code...

Read full topic

item.title: Sigma (framework)- thread layout updated -Inactive
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

blakeman8192:

Great work on this man, I fully support all attempts at writing servers from scratch.

thanks for the support.

Sanskrit:

I love new framework! Best of luck on this project of yours ;D

Thanks for the support man. I’m hoping on finishing an item system by this weekend.

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:20, topic:366850”]How did you design player list management for player updating?
Just looping through all players? Looping through all within the region? Tile based?[/quote]
It currently supports looping through all players, and looping through all players in a region. Currently its toggle-able server sided, but I want to perform more benchmarks / tests in the future to see which is more efficient at certain player counts (IMO, it seems that with 100-200 players looping through all players is much faster than a region system, but only benchmarks will tell). I currently want to make a fairly simple system so that the server can actually decide which updating system to use own its own based on certain variables (like player count, players per area, etc).

Read full topic

As to scalability, its better than PI/ Riotscape, but not quite near hyperion and rs377d.
